name: Avalanche Lake Trail
description: This trail climbs steadily through an old growth forest to reach an alpine lake surrounded by spectacular waterfalls.

images.title: Hiking to Avalanche Lake
images.altText: A park ranger standing in a mountain forest
images.caption: A ranger hiking to Avalanche Lake

raw_listing_description: The Avalanche Lake Trail begins in the same place as the Trail of the Cedars and the Avalanche Campground. The trail climbs steadily through an old growth forest to an alpine like with outstanding waterfalls.
raw_body_text: The Avalanche Lake Trail begins in the same place as the Trail of the Cedars and the Avalanche Campground. The trail climbs steadily through an old growth forest to an alpine like with outstanding waterfalls.

name: Beaver Pond Loop Trailhead
description: This loop trail winds through aspen groves, meadows, and mixed conifer stands across rolling hills, offering a scenic experience for summer hikers and winter snow enthusiasts.

images.title: Beaver Pond Loop Trail
images.altText: A brown sign that reads Historic 1913 Ranger Station and Beaver Pond Loop Trail with an arrow.
images.caption: The loop around Beaver Pond is 3 miles.

raw_listing_description: In the summer, Beaver Pond Loop is a nice, relatively flat trail for hikers. In the winter, this route offers skiing and snowshoeing through aspen, meadows, and mixed conifer stands in the rolling hills east of St.
raw_body_text: The loop trail is 3 miles. In the summer, Beaver Pond Loop is a nice, relatively flat trail for hikers.

name: Forest and Fire Nature Trail
description: This educational nature trail offers insight into the history and ecological significance of wildland fire within Glacier National Park.

images.title: Forest and Fire Nature Trail
images.altText: A trail winds through verdant aspen forest, with a mountain visible in the distance.
images.caption: Walk the trail to see fire's effects for yourself; study the exhibits to learn about fire history.

raw_listing_description: Visit the Forest and Fire Nature Trail to learn about the history and future of wildland fire in Glacier National Park.
raw_body_text: Welcome to the Forest & Fire Nature Trail. Depending on where you’re from, the word “wildfire” can be letters on a page or...

name: Running Eagle Falls Nature Trail
description: This nature trail offers an exploration of native plants and their traditional uses in an area with a long history of human habitation.

images.title: Running Eagle Falls Nature Trail
images.altText: A small wayside with a watercolor drawing of cowparsnip with text about native plants on the trail.
images.caption: Learn about native plants along this nature trail.

raw_body_text: Explore native plants and their traditional uses along this trail. People have lived in this area for centuries, long before it became a park.

name: Running Eagle Falls Trailhead
description: This nature trail offers an accessible walk to the scenic Running Eagle Falls in the Two Medicine area of the park.

images.title: Running Eagle Falls
images.altText: A large waterfall surrounded by rocks and trees.
images.caption: Learn about the story of Running Eagle here.

raw_body_text: The Running Eagle Falls Trailhead is in the Two Medicine area of the park, past the entrance station. This area offers restrooms and accesible hiking opportunities to the Running Eagle Falls and along the Running Eagle Falls Nature Trail.

name: St. Mary Falls Trailhead
description: This popular family-friendly hike leads visitors through world-class scenery to the spectacular St. Mary and Virginia Falls.

images.title: St. Mary Falls Trailhead
images.altText: Cars parked at a parking lot surrounded by mountains
images.caption: Cars parked at St. Mary Falls Trailhead

raw_body_text: The hike to St. Mary and Virginia Falls—family-friendly hikes with world-class scenery—is one of the most popular day hikes on the east side of Going-to-the-Sun Road.

name: Sunrift Gorge
description: Follow a brief trail to an overlook where Baring Creek emerges from a magnificent 800-foot long and 80-foot deep gorge.

images.title: Sunrift Gorge
images.altText: A deep, narrow gorge with a creek flowing through it
images.caption: A view of Sunrift Gorge

raw_body_text: A short, 200 foot trail leads to an overlook where Baring Creek makes exits a magnificent 800-foot long, 80-foot deep gorge. This is also an alternate starting point on the Siyeh Pass Trail, although thanks to it's higher elevation starting point, the most popular place to start this hike is from Siyeh Bend.

name: Trail of the Cedars
description: This peaceful boardwalk nature trail winds through old-growth cedars along Avalanche Creek to views of the powerful Avalanche Gorge.

images.title: Strolling along Trail of the Cedars
images.altText: A ranger leads a family on a boardwalk trail
images.caption: A ranger leads a family on a boardwalk trail.

raw_listing_description: Trail of the Cedars is a peaceful boardwalk nature trail along Avalanche Creek. Follow the boardwalk through old growth cedars, listen to the American dippers, see the powerful force of water carving the Avalanche Gorge.
raw_body_text: Trail of the Cedars is a peaceful boardwalk nature trail along Avalanche Creek. Follow the boardwalk through old growth cedars, listen to the American dippers, see the powerful force of water carving the Avalanche Gorge.
